1 # P4TSA (package for Time Series Analysis) #
2 
3 [![Foo](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-latest-brightgreen.svg?style=flat)](http://p4tsa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/?badge=latest) [![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/elenacuoco/p4TSA.png)](https://travis-ci.org/elenacuoco/p4TSA)
4 
5  (info@elenacuoco.com) https://www.elenacuoco.com
6 
7 This library is a 'spin-off' of C++ Noise Analysis Package (NAP) written together
8 with Giancarlo Cella (giancarlo.cella@pi.infn.it)
9 
10 The core library is written in C++ and should be compiled before using the python interface.
11 
12 The Python interface to the library is pyTSA (you can call it pi'za)
13 
14 ### What is this repository for? ###
15 p4TSA is a minimal package containing ad hoc function to work with time series.
16 It includes
17  * Whitening in time domain
18  * Wavelet decomposition
19  * Wavelet Detection Filter
20 
21 ### How do I get set up? ###
22 
23 * You need to have a python environment setup and some extralibrary (boost, FramLib,gsl,fftw3 installed)
24 * You should run cmake CMakeList.txt
25 * Dependencies: gsl, fftw3, gslcblas, Framelib
26 * Python Binding: it depends on binder and pybind11 which should be installed
27 * Database configuration: none
28 * How to run tests: under dir test run
29 
30  <code>python test.py</code>
31 * Deployment instructions: under python-wrapper directory run
32 
33  <code>python setup.py install</code>
34 
35 ### Contribution guidelines ###
36 
37 * Writing tests
38 * Code review
39 * Other guidelines
40 
41 ### Who do I talk to? ###
42 
43 * Repo owner or admin (info@elenacuoco.com)
44 * Other community or team contact (elena.cuoco@ego-gw.it, giancarlo.cella@pi.infn.it)
